{{Day}}

==Events==
*[[12 BC]] &ndash; The [[Roman Emperor]] [[Augustus]] is named [[Pontifex Maximus]], incorporating the position into that of the Emperor.
* [[961]] &ndash; [[Byzantine]] conquest of [[Chandax]] by [[Nikephoros II Phokas|Nikephoros Phokas]], end of the [[Emirate of Crete]]
*[[1454]] &ndash; [[Thirteen Years' War (1454–66)|Thirteen Years' War]]: Delegates of the [[Prussian Confederation]] pledge allegiance to King [[Casimir IV of Poland]] who agrees to commit his forces in aiding the Confederation's struggle for [[independence]] from the [[Teutonic Knights]].
*[[1521]] &ndash; [[Ferdinand Magellan]] arrives at [[Guam]].
*[[1788]] &ndash; The [[First Fleet]] arrives at [[Norfolk Island]] in order to found a [[convict settlement]].
*[[1820]] &ndash; The [[Missouri Compromise]] is signed into law by President [[James Monroe]]. The compromise allows [[Missouri]] to enter the [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] as a [[slave state]], brings [[Maine]] into the Union as a [[free state (United States)|free state]], and makes the rest of the northern part of the [[Louisiana Purchase]] territory slavery-free.
*[[1834]] &ndash; [[York, Upper Canada|York]], [[Upper Canada]] is incorporated as [[Toronto]].
*[[1836]] &ndash; [[Texas Revolution]]: [[Battle of the Alamo]] &ndash; After a thirteen day [[siege]] by an army of 3,000 Mexican troops, the 187 Texas volunteers, including frontiersman [[Davy Crockett]] and colonel [[Jim Bowie]], defending the [[Alamo Mission in San Antonio|Alamo]] are killed and the fort is captured.
*[[1857]] &ndash; The [[Supreme Court of the United States]] rules in the ''[[Dred Scott v. Sandford]]'' case.
*[[1869]] &ndash; [[Dmitri Mendeleev]] presents the first [[periodic table]] to the Russian Chemical Society.
*[[1882]] &ndash; The [[Kingdom of Serbia|Serbian kingdom]] is re-founded.
*[[1899]] &ndash; [[Bayer]] registers "[[Aspirin]]" as a [[trademark]].
*[[1902]] &ndash; [[Real Madrid C.F.]] was founded.
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[Italy|Italian]] forces became the first to use [[airship]]s in war, as two dirigibles dropped bombs on Turkish troops encamped at [[Janzur]], from an altitude of 6,000 feet.
*[[1921]] &ndash; [[Portuguese Communist Party]] is founded as the Portuguese Section of the [[Comintern|Communist International]].
*[[1930]] &ndash; [[International Unemployment Day]] demonstrations globally initiated by the Comintern
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[Norman Rockwell]] published ''[[Freedom from Want (painting)|Freedom from Want]]'' in the ''[[The Saturday Evening Post]]'' with a matching essay by [[Carlos Bulosan]] as part of the ''[[Four Freedoms (Norman Rockwell)|Four Freedoms]]'' series.
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Cologne]] is captured by American Troops.
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[Ho Chi Minh]] signs an agreement with France which recognizes [[Vietnam]] as an autonomous state in the Indochinese Federation and the [[French Union]].
*[[1951]] &ndash; The trial of [[Ethel and Julius Rosenberg]] begins.
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[Georgy Malenkov]] succeeds [[Joseph Stalin]] as [[Premier of the Soviet Union]] and [[General secretary|First Secretary]] of the [[Communist Party of the Soviet Union]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[Ghana]] becomes the first [[Sub-Saharan Africa|Sub-Saharan]] country to gain independence from the British
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[Ash Wednesday Storm of 1962]] begins on the mid-Atlantic coast of the United States.
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[Nation of Islam]]'s [[Elijah Muhammad]] officially gives [[boxing]] champion [[Cassius Clay]] the name [[Muhammad Ali]].
*  1964   &ndash; [[Constantine II of Greece|Constantine II]] becomes King of Greece.
*[[1965]] &ndash; Premier [[Thomas Playford IV|Tom Playford]] of [[South Australia]] loses power after 27 years in office.
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Joseph Stalin]]'s daughter [[Svetlana Alliluyeva]] [[defection|defects]] to the United States.
*[[1968]] &ndash; The first of the [[East L.A. walkouts]] take place at several high schools.
*  1968   &ndash; Three black males are executed by [[Rhodesia]], the first executions since [[Rhodesia's Unilateral Declaration of Independence|UDI]], prompting international condemnation.
*[[1970]] &ndash; An explosion at the [[Weather Underground]] safe house in Greenwich Village kills three.
*[[1975]] &ndash; For the first time the [[Zapruder film]] of the [[John F. Kennedy assassination|assassination of John F. Kennedy]] is shown in motion to a national TV audience by [[Robert J. Groden]] and [[Dick Gregory]].
*  1975   &ndash; [[1975 Algiers Agreement|Algiers Accord]]: [[Iran]] and [[Iraq]] announce a settlement of their border dispute.
*[[1981]] &ndash; After 19 years of presenting the ''[[CBS Evening News]]'', [[Walter Cronkite]] signs off for the last time.
*[[1983]] &ndash; The first [[United States Football League]] game is played.
*[[1987]] &ndash; The British ferry {{MS|Herald of Free Enterprise}} capsizes in about 90 seconds killing 193.
*[[1988]] &ndash; Three [[Provisional Irish Republican Army]] volunteers are killed by [[Special Air Service]] on the territory of [[Gibraltar]] in the conclusion of [[Operation Flavius]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; Ed Yielding and Joseph T. Vida set the [[Cross-America flight air speed record|transcontinental speed record]] flying a [[SR-71 Blackbird]] from Los Angeles to Virginia in 64 minutes, averaging 2,124 mph.
*[[1992]] &ndash; The [[Michelangelo (virus)|Michelangelo computer virus]] begins to affect computers.
*[[2008]] &ndash; A [[6 March 2008 Baghdad bombing|suicide bomber kills 68 people]] (including first responders) in [[Baghdad]] on the same day that a gunman [[Mercaz HaRav massacre|kills eight students]] in [[Jerusalem]].
